details:
The following vulnerabilities were discovered in the Squeeze's Wireshark
version:


* [CVE-2015-2188](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2015-2188) The WCP dissector could crash
* [CVE-2015-0564](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2015-0564) Wireshark could crash while decypting TLS/SSL sessions
* [CVE-2015-0562](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2015-0562) The DEC DNA Routing Protocol dissector could crash
* [CVE-2014-8714](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-8714) TN5250 infinite loops
* [CVE-2014-8713](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-8713) NCP crashes
* [CVE-2014-8712](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-8712) NCP crashes
* [CVE-2014-8711](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-8711) AMQP crash
* [CVE-2014-8710](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-8710) SigComp UDVM buffer overflow
* [CVE-2014-6432](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-6432) Sniffer file parser crash
* [CVE-2014-6431](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-6431) Sniffer file parser crash
* [CVE-2014-6430](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-6430) Sniffer file parser crash
* [CVE-2014-6429](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-6429) Sniffer file parser crash
* [CVE-2014-6428](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-6428) SES dissector crash
* [CVE-2014-6423](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-6423) MEGACO dissector infinite loop
* [CVE-2014-6422](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2014-6422) RTP dissector crash


Since back-porting upstream patches to 1.2.11-6+squeeze15 did not fix
all the outstanding issues and some issues are not even tracked publicly
the LTS Team decided to sync squeeze-lts's wireshark package with
wheezy-security to provide the best possible security support.


Note that upgrading Wireshark from 1.2.x to 1.8.x introduces
several backward-incompatible changes in package structure, shared
library API/ABI, availability of dissectors and in syntax of command
line parameters.
